document_title: Dysmenorrhea: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
First, the doctor will examine your general health and gynecological examination, and collect information about your personal medical history and family history to detect risk factors. During a gynecological examination, the doctor will conduct an examination and detect abnormalities in the reproductive organs, if any.
In case secondary dysmenorrhea is suspected to be related to a medical condition, the doctor will ask women to participate in some necessary tests, which may include:
Ultrasound: to see images of the uterus, cervix, ovaries and fallopian tubes.; Scan CT, MRI or combine CT and X-ray depending on each specific case.; Laparoscopy: detects uterine fibroids, endometriosis, ovarian cysts or ectopic pregnancy.
